Description.Text: Despite it's quiet location, it is only 20minutes from Junction 24 off the M62 and offer's complimentary WI-FI , restaurant, beauty salon, and free parking. Situated within 1.5 acres of beautifully mature gardens and woodland, this historic 19th Century family-run hotel is perfect for those seeking a peaceful, yet welcoming retreat. This magnificent Hotel was originally built in 1870 and converted into a hotel in 1975, ensuring that it still retained the traditional grandeur and charm of its' Victorian origins. Stylishly blending the old with the new, it succeeds in crafting a distinctive ambiance of luxurious splendour and homely comfort. This, coupled with its' picturesque location, beautiful grounds and impeccable commitment to service provision, has helped the Hotel garner an impressive reputation for exceeding all expectations.Each of the 30 en-suite bedrooms are individually designed and furnished whilst still retaining the traditional character and allure of the building's historic origins. The hotel offers free breakfast to its guests.

Durker Roods Hotel is located in the foothills of the Peak District National park, yet is only a 15 minute drive from the market town of Huddersfield. It is easily accessible from junction 24 of the M62, Huddersfield train station offers fantastic transport links to most major destinations across the UK and for those flying in; Leeds Bradford Airport is only a 50 minute drive away whilst Manchester International Airport is not an hour's distance from the Hotel. Just a short distance away, there are a wealth of local attractions and tourist sites to visit. Just a quick 10 minute drive away is the picturesque town of Holmfirth, famous for being the location of the popular BBC series 'Last of the Summer Wine'. There's more to Holmfirth than just Compo, Cleggy and Foggy, including many delightful gift shops and craft galleries as well as a wide variety of eateries, restaurants and traditional English public houses. Huddersfield is a true Yorkshire town, home to strong traditions.

Classic - Double - Classic Double offers one double bed or two twin beds. Each of the 30 en-suite bedrooms are individually designed and furnished whilst still retaining the traditional character and allure of the building's historic origins. Comfort and relaxation are very much the order of the day and this is reflected in the wide range of modern conveniences and luxuries that each room has to offer. Including; complimentary Wi-Fi access, remote-controlled TV, hairdryer, tea & coffee making facilities and fluffy bath towels. There are a range of cosy room options available, from double and twin to Family size and singles, a luxurious Bridal suite, and several rooms on the ground floor for disabled access. Twin rooms must be requested at time of booking and are subject to availability.
